titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the anniversary of the birth of Malcom X should be observed as a day of prayer, remembrance, and reflection on the life of Malcolm X.
Expressing the sense of Congress that the anniversary of the birth of Malcom X should be observed as a day of prayer, remembrance, and reflection on the life of Malcolm X.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

term.name: Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues

bill.summary: Calls for observing May 19th, the anniversary of the birth of Malcolm X, as a day of prayer, remembrance, and reflection on his life.
